snippet: Mustafa Abdel-Jalil, the leader of the National Transitional Council, warned that the government faces “bitter options” as it struggles to reign in thousands of militia fighters.
abstract: Libya's transitional leader Mustafa Abdel-Jalil warns that the government faces 'bitter options' as it struggles to reign in thousands of militia fighters who are reluctant to disarm because they hope to protect their regions' interests as the future government takes shape.
lead_paragraph: Mustafa Abdel-Jalil, the leader of the National Transitional Council, warned that the government faces “bitter options” as it struggles to reign in thousands of militia fighters.

headline.seo: Libyan Leader Warns Militias Could Create Civil War
headline.main: Libyan Leader Says Militia Clashes Could Create Civil War
headline.print_headline: Libyan Leader Says Militia Clashes Could Create Civil War
